fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35359].
  {panel}

This is related to JDEV-25501. 

Try https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?projectKeys=TST&issuetypeName=Bug&expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
notice that assignee field is marked as required.

From testing we concluded that
- the returned value ignores the "allow unassigned issues" flag
- most likely JAC has corrupted data

[~mquail] and [~mlassau] have more technical info.
fields.summary: rest metadata call on JAC wrongly claims that assignee field is a required field
Please provide link to release notes in release announcement
I need a way to put text/titles on my wallboard to explain what my gadgets are displaying
Background re-indexing can cause excesive memory consumption leading to the instance becoming unresponsive.
Allow "mentioned user" to be added to permission schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35354].
  {panel}

The documentation found here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server

Specifically this paragraph:

3.4 Migrate your existing JIRA configurations over to your new JIRA installation
If you have modified properties in configuration files of your existing JIRA installation, make the same modifications in your new JIRA installation. However, because the properties in the configuration files may have changed between versions, you cannot simply copy the configuration files from your existing installation and replace the equivalent files in the new installation.

Needs to be improved to specify which configuration files are relevant.
fields.summary: Documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server
Able to update priority of sub-task from drop down menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35351].
  {panel}

When a user searches for issues in a specific project (or a list or projects) and he does not have the Browse Project permission for the project, he gets the following message

*The value '10001' does not exist for the field 'project'*
Where '10001' is the project ID or name used in the JQL.

This message could be different for projects that do exist but the user simply does not have permission to browse it, like the following.
*You do not have permission to browse the project '10001'* 

This would help a lot of customers that get this message and may believe the project has been deleted somehow.
fields.summary: Change message displayed in Issue Navigator for projects without browse permission
Update 'Connecting JIRA to MySQL' article
atlassian REST latest document site is down

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35340].
  {panel}

The "Save" Option is not provided when user modify their JQL for existing filter in Advanced Search due to a search has to be performed prior to the save.

There's a difference between Simply search and Advance Search. For simple search, the search result would be refresh once you chose some options. However in Advanced Search, the save option only available right after a search on modified JQL in existing filter was performed by the user.

An information should be given under the *To update the search criteria of one of your existing filters:* section of the following documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Filters#UsingFilters-updating_filter_detailsUpdatingafilter
fields.summary: Add an information to Update filter documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35327].
  {panel}

I downloaded the JIRA 6.1 trial version and came across the Issue Collector concept.
This seemed like a really neat idea to help integrate JIRA creation with any website.
I created an Issue Collector with a custom form containing my custom fields along with some native fields for hte users to fill in, and copied the provided HTML to a Script Editor web part on a page in SharePoint.

This allowed me to request the creation of a JIRA, but the form layout was scrambled, so whilst all of the fields did exist it was hard to see them and enter values - see attached screen shots.
 '_1' shows the Summary and Description fields - there is no scroll bar, the field names are seen under the field value boxes.
 '_2' shows what happens when I manage eventually to scroll down to the other fields - again the field names are under the field value boxes
'_3' shows another attempt to create an issue and scroll down when it wouldn't let me go past the Environment field, seen at the top above the Summary and Description fields
'_4' shows what I see when I finally give up and submit the issue!

The HTML that I inserted into the Script Editor web part is as follows:

<script type="text/javascript" src="http://localhost:8080/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e/en_GBio9p4o-1988229788/6144/4/1.4.0-m6/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector/com.atlassian.jira.collector.plugin.jira-issue-collector-plugin:issuecollector.js?collectorId=d881c35c"></script>

Please let me know if you need any more information from me.

When I tried using the standard Issue Collector Feedback form, this worked perfectly using the same method of adding it to the SharePoint page
fields.summary: Issue Collector custom form scrambled
Testing JIRA ACA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35316].
  {panel}

We currently document our requirements in both Jira and Confluence. The process is that we first create sketches that we discuss and agree on, create the epic(s) and user stories in Jira, describe these as detailed as necessary, break them down, estimate and start the work. In the middle of this there is also an approval per issue to ensure that we haven't misunderstood each other along the way. 

Once the user stories are approved the requirements are transferred to Confluence for later reference - they are also "bound" together to make it easier to read as a whole if needed. 

What we would like is to write the descriptions fully in Confluence and tag them with anchors or similar, and then link these specific anchors from Jira. In this way we would only have to write the descriptions once, and we do not risk the possible differences between what is described in the two different systems. 

I know you can write something in Confluence, "mention" the Jira-issue and this way get a link between the two. But that would again require the developer to go back and forth, which is not very optimal for us.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to link and show the contents from a Confluence page in the description of a Jira issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35305].
  {panel}

I would love to have a functionality that allows administrators to set a date and align all support contracts for all plugins and system licenses to a single date in the year, calculating the prorate, example:

Align all expiration dates to Dec 6th 2014, so:

JIRA Agile will be renewed for 365 days
JIRA Miscellaneous will be renewed for 331 days

This allows to make one order per year instead of multiple ones.

Best regards
Claudio Ombrella
fields.summary: Alignment of expiration dates in plugins and system licenses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35304].
  {panel}

This feature lists a table with the plugins and their next expiration date and days left, example:

JIRA Agile 10000 users     Dec 6th 2013   65 days left
JIRA Miscellaneous workflow Jan 15th 2014 99 days left

Today we have that information but you need to open plugin by plugin to see the dates.

Some color indicators are welcome as well to easily identify the soon to expire plugins. An additional email notification to jira-system-administrators would be also ideal.
Best regards
Claudio Ombrella
fields.summary: Plugin maintenance expiration calendar

User currently concerns about how the custom field show in Issue Navigator.

h4.Steps of reproduce the result:
# Add a new custom field known as custom field A and associate only for Project A _(any issue type)_.
# UserB only have all permission's for Project B.
# UserB does not have access to ProjectA, however when UserB searches for an issue and clicks on the more button it displays the custom field (grayed out)

Custom field should not appear in Issue Navigator or searchable by the user.

fields.description: When some of our Issues are updated, instead of sending an email to watchers with the single update, we receive one email for every update that has ever happened on the Issue. For example, if an Issue has had 15 comments previously, when the 16th is logged, every watcher receives 16 individual emails for the new comment and each prior. As I said, this only happens with some Issues. We haven't isolated which ones, but as an example, the Issue "BUGS-860" on our account is currently behaving this way.
fields.summary: Email notifications are being sent for old updates
Documentation on Custom Events has a broken link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35279].
  {panel}

With JIRA 6.1, edit any field configuration that has more than two dozen custom fields.
Try to find out which fields are required without scanning the list every field by hand.
Now try that with 300 custom fields!

In older versions of JIRA an admin could use the Find button in their browser to search for strings such as "Required" or "Hidden". The changes for 6.1 mean that the string to indicate whether a field is required is the same as the string for the link to *make* the field required. This means it's much harder to find which fields are required in a field configuration.
fields.summary: No way to find required fields in a Field Configuration except by inspection
Allow custom field options/default value to be configured during initial "Create Custom Field" steps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35271].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* Create a project
* Create some issues
* Check the activity stream on the dashboard and on the project. The issues shouldn't have a strikethough:

!activity_stream_no_strikethrough.png!

* Now, edit the screen associated to the Create Issue operation and add the resolution field.

* Create an issue. Notice the resolution field is pre-populated with the Default value set for the resolution. Click on "Create" and open the issue. Notice the resolution is set "Unresolved" (actually, there's no way to set the resolution field when creating the issue, since the field is always cleared once the issue is created).

* Check the Activity Stream on the dashboard and on the project. Notice the issue will have the strikethrough present, even with the resolution set to Unresolved.

!activity_stream_strikethrough.png!

!issue.png!


!activity_stream.png!
fields.summary: Resolution field on the create issue screen causes issues to be shown on the activity stream with a strikethrough

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35252].
  {panel}

As an admin, it may be necessary to set a user avatar. This could be to remove an inappropriate one, or to set a standard one our org uses. Ideally, this functionality would be exposed via the REST API so user creation can be further automated. 
* Sub feature is to "lock" an avatar and not allow it to be edited by a user.
* Sub feature is to allow editing of multiple user's avatars at once

Current ability to accomplish this happens in one of 2 ways:

1. Use a third party plugin to allow me to SU to a user. Then modify it while logged in as them
2. Change the users password, log in as them, make the change. In the event of an LDAP infrastructure, this means locking them out of multiple systems.
fields.summary: Allow admins to edit user avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35250].
  {panel}

*Description*
If the name of a project is same as the key of another project, then, when using JQL to search by name on the first project would retrieve all issues from the second project.

h4. First Symptom
*Steps to reproduce*
1. Create the first project with name: *My Test Project*, key: *MTP*
2. Create the second project with name *MTP*, key: *MP*
3. Seach with advance JQL: 
{code}project ="MTP"{code}
4. All issues belong to *My Test Project* project are retrieved.

*Expected result*
All issues belong to *MTP* project should be retrieved.


h4. Second Symptom
*Steps to reproduce*
# create first project with name *My Test Project*, key: *MTP*
# create second project with name *MTP*, key: *MP*
# create a new JQL, insert:
{code}
project=MTP
{code}
# select project with key *MP* from the suggested list
# hit Enter and the issue for project with key "MTP" is return

*Expected Result*
Issue for project with key "MP" is return as user manually select the project from the suggestion list


*Workaround*
Searching based on the Key, for example
{code}project = MP{code}
fields.summary: Wrong filter result if project name duplicate with other project key
List places where you're mentioned
Add info on the Issue Security docs
Email notification to include all parties in the associated JIRA user pickers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35240].
  {panel}

I have encountered a significant and unadvertised difficulty in accessing the REST API.

I am working on an iOS app, which consumes information programmatically but doesn't handle redirects and cookies--I'm not saying that there's not probably something out there, but the tried and true standby of accessing https://username:password@hostname/rest/api/2/foo . And after pulling out my hair after figuring out why my iOS code wasn't handling JSON appropriately, I tried something.

I entered, in a browser window, https://username:password@hostname/rest/api/2/foo , and two things happened:

1: The correct data was displayed, and:

2: The URL was retconned to https://hostname/rest/api/2/foo

The reason why I only got empty results was that a REST API pull of https://username:password@hostname/rest/api/2/foo does not behave as one would expect from a REST API, especially not one as simple and powerful as JIRA genuinely offers.

I'm pretty much dead in the water for my original approach to getting data. I can circumvent this issue by manually copying data from JIRA to static content on my own server, but that is a workaround to a development blocker, not a solution, even a cumbersome one, to real production usage. You might be able to help me work around this difficulty, but if you're going to advertise a RESTful API, it would be nice if you didn't practically defeat the REST standby of https://username:password@hostname/rest/api/2/foo

I'm open to learning cookies or whatever powers live human browser usage of your REST API, but your failure to support basic authentication over HTTPS had me pulling my hair out trying to figure out what I had done wrong in iOS to not let iOS handle your JSON properly.

I think a REST API with support for basic authentication would be a major improvement.
fields.summary: As a developer consuming REST API, I would like to get results when I pull data from https://username:password@hostname.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/foo
Enhance Cascading Select Custom Field to allow auto complete in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35237].

The following issue will show on the issue view page during the issue occurrence:
{noformat}
Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:attachmentmodule'. Please contact your JIRA administrators.
{noformat}

The following error message is showing in the log file:
{code}
        2013-10-09 19:00:49,487 http-bio-8081-exec-33 ERROR jpolley 1140x2102x1 10p3h9x 59.167.133.100,172.24.36.107,127.0.0.1 /rest/api/2/search [core.util.thumbnail.Thumber] Unable to create thumbnail image for id 80896
com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.ThumbnailRenderException: java.io.IOException: Cannot read image - none of loaders was able to create image
        at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.ThumbnailRenderer.createThumbnailImage(ThumbnailRenderer.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.createThumbnail(Thumber.java:382)
        at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.retrieveOrCreateThumbNail(Thumber.java:355)
        at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.retrieveOrCreateThumbNail(Thumber.java:322)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager$1$1.withInputStream(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:272)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager$1$1.withInputStream(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:268)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.withStreamConsumer(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:422)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.access$700(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager$1.get(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:267)

{code}

Check [this other bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29357] with the same error.

(!) Please note that the service desk will be affected during the issue occurrence. 

*Workaround solution:*
Please use the "Manage Attachments" Menu to delete the attachment file and attach it again after compressed it. Or you can disable the thumbnail generation in the page "Administration >> System >> Attachments".
fields.summary: Attachment thumbnails generation failed with some image
Support the Chrome browser on Android 4.1+
default watchers per component

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35233].
  {panel}

I am using JIRA 5.2 version and have Sop-client running for that. I use Jira webservices and updates the Jira tickets. I have trouble with one of the customfield's value which is select list.

- Is it possible to add new value in a "select List" value list when I update ticket using Jira webservices? I can see that value does not exists but I am not sure if I can add new value in that list or not. 

If its possible then can you please provide example for this? 

Thank you for your help! 

Thanks,
Seema Sangani
fields.summary: Can you add new value to custom field which is type of "Select List" ?
Restrict File Upload
Create new project on Stash
Upgrade DVCS Connector plugin to version 1.4.3 in OnDemand
Allow configuration for more in-depth SQL logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35227].
  {panel}

We've recently upgraded to JIRA 6.0.8 from 5.2.11, and one of the first things my users noticed is that the width of the Text and Free Text fields (including the built-in ones like _Summary_ and _Description_) has been reduced significantly on Create and Edit forms.

In general, we love the new interface, but this specific example is causing some pain, as the UI now makes it more difficult to enter large amounts of text.  Also, unlike in previous releases, the "max-width" property is being set for these fields, meaning that users aren't allowed to enlarge the text boxes for Free Text fields in browsers that provide that capability (like Chrome).  This is triggering a lot of "workaround" behaviour, where people are using other tools to write their text, and then pasting it into the JIRA form...this is not a good model, as it is very error-prone.

My users noticed that the new widths are being equally applied to the static Create and Edit forms, as on the QuickCreate and QuickEdit forms, even though the static forms have much more room to work with.  This used to be the favoured approach by those that didn't like the smaller fields on the QuickCreate/QuickEdit forms, but there is no longer any difference between the forms.

Currently, these fields are being styled with the "long-field" class.  This request is to re-classify these fields as "full-width-field", which does not set the max-width attribute.
fields.summary: Please use "full-width-field" style for Text and Free Text fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35224].
  {panel}

Many of our customers come to our team and ask for change their workflow.
Currently we have lots of workflows in our Jira.

How about some small search feature for workflows.

- Select statuses your customer is interested in.
- Jira displays only matching workflows with this statuses.
- Jira displays images of the workflows (because an image is a thousand words and it is easier to see the difference)
- You may zoom in (pop-up) an image with workflow
- Select desired one and have popup with a question to which Issue Types assign to (automaticly create workflow scheme)
fields.summary: Workflow search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35220].
  {panel}

When pressing either the dot or the comma when I'm in the detail screen of an issue, the same dialog is shown containing a mix of Issue/Workflow Operations and Edit Field Operations.

In my opinion, these actions should display two separate dialog's. 
* The dot dialog should only display Issue/Workflow Operations
* The comma dialog should only display Edit Field Operations.

This difference used to be there in pre 6.0 versions of JIRA. In the current setup, additional keyboard actions are required to, for example, assign an issue via a workflow action. When pressing the dot, and typing *assign*, the edit field action is selected first, in this case however, I want to perform the specified workflow action and have to choose this manually using the arrow keys.

Could the two dialog's please be separated again?

Kind regards,
Sander Moelands
fields.summary: dot en comma shortcuts show the same dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35218].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Projects with long names are cut off in the create issue screen as the project drop-down is only 250px.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a project with a long name.
# Create an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The drop down has sufficient space to display the project name.

h3. Actual Results

The project name is cut off as per the example.

h3. Notes

This could be fixed by extending the 250px width to 500px which would be sufficient and also kinda lines up with the rest of the page.

h3. Workaround

* The JIRA files could be altered to change the display of the drop downs - if you'd like to do this please raise it on [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/] as it's unsupported - see a sample CSS fix in the [comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35218?focusedCommentId=622714&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-622714].
* Note that you should be able to see the project name in full, by hovering your mouse over each project name from the drop-down list.
* The project name can be shortened so that it correctly appears.
fields.summary: Project drop down in Create Issue screen cuts off long project names
Issue Collector Oops Error Improvement
Buttons disappear when hovering over title
Add possibility to automatically add value to a select/multi select list custom field when the value is not previously added
JIRA mobile: Add ability to do basic searching
test case 2
test case 1
Allow the adding of custom field values via REST API
GS ACFs
Simple toggle switches for required and hidden fields

fields.description:
In table cwd_user_attributes, there should be one group records for one user. I found that there are multi-group records for one user_id. For example,
select * from cwd_user_attributes where user_id=13439;
the output is:
ID             user_id   d_id  attribute_name                attribute_value lower_att_value
160432	13439	2	login.currentFailedCount	0	0
160433	13439	2	login.currentFailedCount	0	0
160434	13439	2	login.currentFailedCount	0	0
160435	13439	2	login.lastLoginMillis	1380325221125	1380325221125
160436	13439	2	login.lastLoginMillis	1380325221126	1380325221126
160437	13439	2	login.lastLoginMillis	1380325221127	1380325221127
160438	13439	2	login.previousLoginMillis	1379979521237	1379979521237
160439	13439	2	login.previousLoginMillis	1379979521237	1379979521237
160440	13439	2	login.previousLoginMillis	1379979521237	1379979521237
=======================================
My questions are:
1. Are they correct?
2. What cause these?
3. Should I clean up this table, to remove the duplicate records?
fields.summary: multi records for one entry in cwd_user_atttributes pf JIRA DB

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35190].
  {panel}

It seems that recent changes have just caused this

1. Go to any issue on JAC with a link to a Confluence page e.g. on EAC
e.g.  CONF-1095
2. If you aren't OAuthed you should se a link to an OAuth prompt - you don't. 

Some recent changes that _may_ have caused this:
* Coathanger project may have touched this
* AppLinks upgrade? //cc [~mminns]
fields.summary: Linking and displaying links to Confluence pages no longer working with OAUTH

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35189].
  {panel}

The _Issue Type_ label is not consistent between JIRA screens.

If you go to the Create Issue screen, you will see the "Issue Type" label.
However, when you open the ticket details, the label is just "Type". 

This can confuse the users during the issue creation or when viewing any issues in JIRA.
fields.summary: Issue Type label is not consistent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-35188].
  {panel}

Enabling the Stash Integration, you end up with two tabs in the JIRA issue: Source and Commits. But the commits can't be disabled, if you try do disable the DVCS plugin (that is now a System Plugin), the Commits tab will disappear, however, you will also loose the ability to create Branches from JIRA.

*Steps to reproduce:*

- Integrate JIRA with Stash.
- The issues will have two tabs: Commits and Source. All your Stash related information is in the Source tab.
- Try to remove the Commits by disabling the System Plugin _JIRA DVCS Connector Plugin_.
- Then you miss the Create Branch as well.

*Expected bevahiour:*

The commits tab should not be shown if the only integration is with Stash and there are not DVCS accounts using the Commits tab.
fields.summary: Stash integration break when trying to remove Commits tab
Remove Versions from the administrative permissions
Allow to view all options in dropdowns
